cost_breakdown.reasons: This trajectory is very safe and comfortable as it waits patiently, maintaining its lane position and a large distance from the oncoming car. However, it is highly inefficient because it makes no progress towards the intended left turn.

This trajectory has a poor safety score due to significant deviation from the intended left-turn reference path. It is inefficient as it fails to execute the turn, instead proceeding straight. Comfort is acceptable as the motion itself is smooth.

This is the optimal trajectory. It balances all criteria well by safely yielding to the oncoming vehicle and then executing a smooth, comfortable, and efficient left turn. It follows a good path and makes excellent progress.

This trajectory is unacceptable due to extreme safety risk. It attempts to cut in front of the oncoming vehicle, creating a high probability of collision. The required abrupt maneuver would also be very uncomfortable and inefficient.
